intro: Bucinella paramicola, commonly known as the Paramicola trumpet-shell, is a species of sea snail belonging to the family Trochidae. It is characterized by its elongated, conical shell that is typically yellowish or brownish in color. The shell features a smooth surface with a distinct spiral pattern and a prominent siphonal canal. This species is found in marine environments, primarily in the Indo-Pacific region. Bucinella paramicola plays a role in its ecosystem as both a prey item and a contributor to the benthic community.
